{"currentConversationId":"08bca445-29fb-4605-9931-123fdc7c700a","conversations":{"198aebaf-63c2-4e8f-a773-6f8c2e16838d":{"id":"198aebaf-63c2-4e8f-a773-6f8c2e16838d","createdAtIso":"2025-08-14T17:12:47.034Z","lastInteractedAtIso":"2025-08-17T21:07:44.673Z","chatHistory":[{"chatItemType":"exchange-pointer","exchangeUuid":"03960b48-7a41-465d-802d-f3b5cf7b7a04","timestamp":"2025-08-14T17:38:15.732Z","request_message":"this is a new empty project you are to execute and build this local running program, using florence 2 to auto sort given images into datasets. ANCHOR:[SAGE-BUILD]
BEHAVIOR:
 - [SCOPE:FULL] => Plan → scaffold → implement → test → deliver.
 - [WALK:ON] => Print stepwise plan before code; mark milestones ✅.
 - [DOCS:WRITE] => Generate README, environment.yml, and inline docs.
 - [UI:GRADIO] => Local web UI with drag/drop, gallery, caption editor.
 - [SAFE:ON] => No destructive ops; show shell cmds; log errors.
 - [EDIT:RESPECT] => Don’t overwrite user edits without diff/confirm.

PROJECT: CaptionStrike — Local Dataset Builder
GOAL: A local-first app where the user creates a project, drags media, presses RUN, and gets a ready-to-train dataset. Primary perception model: **Florence-2** (caption + tags + grounding). Optional “explain/Q&A” model: **Qwen2.5-VL-7B**. Alt single-model route: **MiniCPM-V 2.6**.

PRIMARY REQUIREMENTS
1) Environment
 - Conda env name: `CaptionStrike` (python=3.10).
 - Core deps: pytorch/torchvision/torchaudio, ffmpeg, gradio, opencv-python, pillow, numpy, pydub, librosa, ulid-py, tqdm, transformers, timm, sentencepiece.
 - Perception:
 • **Florence-2** (HuggingFace) for captioning, tagging, grounding/region labels.
 • Optional: **Qwen2.5-VL-7B-Instruct** for longer, reasoned descriptions (toggle).
 • Optional (single-model mode): **MiniCPM-V 2.6**.
 - Segmentation/isolation: insightface, ultralytics (YOLO), segment-anything (SAM wrapper).
 - Audio: pyannote.audio (diarization), faster-whisper (STT).
 - Export a working `environment.yml` with the above.

2) Filesystem & Tokens
 - Root: user-specified (e.g., `D:/Datasets`).
 - Project layout:
 <root>/<project>/
 raw/{image,video,audio}
 processed/{image,video,audio,thumbs}
 meta/{project.json, run_logs.jsonl}
 - Conversions: image→.png, video→.mp4 (H.264 + faststart), audio→.mp3 (192 kbps).
 - Append `TKN-(ULID)` to every processed filename; end each caption `.txt` with `[TKN-<ULID>]`.
 - Log every processed item to `meta/run_logs.jsonl`.

3) Captioning & Tagging (Florence-2 first)
 - **Images**: Florence-2 caption + tag set (objects/attributes). Compose one-line caption focused on subject, setting, lighting, mood; append token.
 - **Videos**: analyze first frame with Florence-2; derive `[ACTION:<verb/noun>]` tag (from detected objects/attributes or brief LLM rewrite); include it in the video caption.
 - If `reasoning.enabled=true` in `project.json`, pass the Florence-2 summary + thumbnail into Qwen2.5-VL-7B for a refined one-sentence caption; otherwise use Florence-2 caption directly.
 - Keep captions deterministic & concise; no emoji, no special chars beyond the token.

4) Audio Isolation & Stitching
 - Inputs: optional reference voice clip OR (first_sound_ts, end_ts).
 - Run diarization (pyannote) on full audio; select speaker by overlap to reference or longest-duration fallback.
 - Stitch matched segments chronologically → `<base>__TKN-<ULID>__single_speaker.mp3`.
 - Create `.txt` listing segments used and short transcript summary (faster-whisper OK); append token.

5) Person Isolation (optional)
 - InsightFace detect → save face crops under `processed/image/crops/`.
 - Optional: refine foreground with SAM; preserve original + cropped variants.
 - For videos, allow “sample N frames” toggle for quick person-crops set.

6) UI (Local server)
 - Gradio Blocks:
 • Project dropdown + “Create Project”
 • Drag/drop files
 • Toggles: “Isolate person”, “Use reasoning model”
 • Inputs: reference voice clip path, first_sound_ts, end_ts
 • “RUN pipeline” button + live status console
 • Gallery (256px thumbnails). Clicking an item opens caption `.txt` in an inline editor
 - Idempotent runs (no clobber); show counts & errors; allow re-run on selected items.

7) Modularity & Config
 - `meta/project.json` controls:
 {
 "models": {
 "captioner": "florence2-base|florence2-large",
 "reasoning": { "enabled": false, "model": "Qwen2.5-VL-7B-Instruct" },
 "single_model_mode": false,
 "single_model": "MiniCPM-V-2_6"
 },
 "action": { "method": "first_frame", "rewrite_with_llm": true },
 "isolation": { "faces": true, "sam_refine": false }
 }
 - Adapters:
 /src/adapters/florence2_captioner.py
 /src/adapters/qwen_vl_reasoner.py (optional)
 /src/adapters/minicpmv_captioner.py (optional alt)
 /src/adapters/action_tagger.py
 /src/adapters/diarizer.py
 /src/adapters/person_isolator.py

8) Testing & Acceptance
 - `sample_media/` with 1 image, 1 short video, 1 audio.
 - `tests/smoke_test.py` ensures: conversions, TKN naming, Florence-2 captions, video `[ACTION:...]`, diarization stitch, thumbnails, run_logs write.
 - Print Acceptance Checklist on first run.

IMPLEMENTATION STEPS (execute & show diffs)
1) Plan: print numbered tasks; await “OK GO”.
2) Scaffold repo (src/adapters, src/core, src/ui, tests, sample_media).
3) Write `environment.yml`.
4) Implement core utilities: `media.py` (probes, conversions, thumbs), `tokens.py`, `io.py` (layout, captions, logs).
5) Implement **florence2_captioner.py**:
 - Load HF model & processor (configurable id).
 - `caption(image: PIL|np) -> {caption:str, tags:[str], boxes:[…]}`.
 - `caption_video_first_frame(video_path) -> {action_tag:str, caption:str}`.
6) Implement optional **qwen_vl_reasoner.py**:
 - `refine(one_line:str, image_thumb) -> one_line_refined`.
7) Implement **diarizer.py** (pyannote + stitch) and **person_isolator.py** (InsightFace + optional SAM).
8) Implement **pipeline.py**:
 - Walk raw folders → convert → caption/tag (Florence-2) → optional refine with Qwen → write `.txt` with `[TKN-…]` → logs → thumbs; optional isolation.
9) Build **ui/app.py** (Gradio Blocks) with drop area, RUN, gallery + inline editor.
10) Add `README.md`, sample media, smoke test, print Acceptance Checklist.

ACCEPTANCE CHECKLIST (must pass)
- [ ] `conda env create -f environment.yml` and `conda activate CaptionStrike` succeed.
- [ ] `python app.py --root "D:/Datasets" --models_dir "./models"` launches local UI.
- [ ] Creating a project writes `meta/project.json` with Florence-2 default.
- [ ] Dropping mixed media populates `raw/{image,video,audio}`.
- [ ] RUN produces processed files with `__TKN-<ULID>` stems + paired `.txt`.
- [ ] Image captions come from **Florence-2**; video captions include `[ACTION:…]`.
- [ ] Audio diarization outputs stitched single-speaker `.mp3` + segment `.txt`.
- [ ] Thumbnails render in gallery; inline caption edits persist.
- [ ] `meta/run_logs.jsonl` has one entry per processed item.

DELIVERABLES
- `environment.yml`
- `README.md`
- `app.py` (root launcher importing from /src)
- `/src/{adapters,core,ui,tests}` as listed
- `/sample_media/…`
- `meta/project.json` template

NOTES
- Default model IDs and quant flags are read from `project.json`.
- If Florence-2 weights are missing, print a friendly instruction and keep running (stub captions).
- If reasoning is enabled but Qwen model isn’t present, fall back to Florence-2 only.

BEGIN NOW. If `AugmentInstructions.txt` is present at repo root, read it and show a short “diff” section in README titled “Adjustments from AugmentInstructions.txt”, then proceed.

environment inside this IDE "}]}]},"model_id":"gpt5-med-200k-v7-c4-p2-agent","mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"## Quick answer

To let me open and use a Conda environment inside this IDE on Windows 11, ensure Conda is installed and initialized for your default shell, then tell me which environment to use. After that, I can activate it and run commands for you.

## Step-by-step (Windows 11)

1) Install Conda (if not already)
- Recommended: Miniconda from https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/miniconda.html
- During install: allow it to register for your user (don’t “Add to PATH” is fine; we can init it per-shell).

2) Initialize Conda for your shell
- Open Windows Terminal (PowerShell) and run:
 - PowerShell:
 - conda init powershell
 - Command Prompt (CMD):
 - conda init cmd.exe
- Close and reopen the terminal to apply changes.

3) Optional: keep base off by default
- conda config --set auto_activate_base false

4) Verify Conda is available
- In a new terminal:
 - conda --version
 - conda env list

5) Create or point me to your project env
- If you have environment.yml in X:/CaptionStrike:
 - conda env create -f environment.yml -n captionstrike
- Or create manually:
 - conda create -n captionstrike python=3.11
- Let me know the exact environment name (e.g., captionstrike).

6) Grant me permission to run terminal commands here
- Say “yes, go ahead” and tell me the env name. I’ll activate it within this IDE’s terminal session and keep it active for subsequent commands.

## What I will do for you (with your OK)

- Start a persistent terminal and run:
 - conda --version
 - conda env list
 - conda activate <your-env>
 - python --version
 - where python
- I’ll report the logs and any errors immediately and keep the session active for future commands.

## If Conda isn’t auto-detected

If conda isn’t on PATH in the IDE terminal, share your Conda install path (for example, C:\Users\YourName\miniconda3). I can use absolute scripts:

- CMD session:
 - "C:\Users\YourName\miniconda3\Scripts\activate.bat" C:\Users\YourName\miniconda3
 - conda activate <your-env>
- PowerShell session (one-time init if needed):
 - & "C:\Users\YourName\miniconda3\condabin\conda.bat" init powershell
 - Restart terminal, then conda activate <your-env>

## Debug points and quick checks

- Check 1: Conda available
 - Command: conda --version
 - Expect: conda 24.x or similar
- Check 2: Envs list
 - Command: conda env list
 - Expect: your env appears, e.g., captionstrike
- Check 3: Activation
 - Command: conda activate captionstrike && python --version && where python
 - Expect: Python version prints and path resolves under your env’s directory
- Common errors and fixes
 - “conda not recognized”: run conda init for your shell, then restart terminal
 - “Environment not found”: confirm the env name or create it
 - Activation in PowerShell blocked: set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope CurrentUser RemoteSigned

## Your call

- Do you want me to run the quick verification now and activate a specific environment?
- If yes, please provide:
 - The environment name to use (or permission to create one from environment.yml)
 - Whether I should use PowerShell or CMD
 - If Conda is not initialized, the absolute path to your Conda install (optional but helpful)

Once you confirm, I’ll proceed, report the logs live, and keep the terminal session ready for your next steps.
